Замечательная игра всем советую внеё поиграть. Пожеланию можно пройти одиночную кампанию, но только если вы проходили первую часть. Мультиплеер в данной игре очень замечательный, но бывают карты над которыми можно думать очень долго и даже иногда надоедает и нужно переходить к другой.

Sehr guter Nachfolger für Teil 1 :)
Der (Galgen-) Humor ist einfach fantastisch, die Grafik sieht einfach nur phänomenal aus und die Level sind sehr gut durchdacht und bieten einen langen Spielspass!
2da Parte De Universo Portal, Avanza en la "historia" dejando algunas cosas a la imaginacion. Profundiza en la jugabilidad, las posibilidades con los portales y mas.

Portal2 is fun and slightly creepy puzzle game, in this game you must place portals to get through the level and not die.  I also like the ability to test other peoples levels and would like to make my own (though i am not sure how).  I rate this game 10/10

For the fact that this is a seuqal to a top selling game, Valve did an outstanding job with giving a backstory to this game! And (some may have not noticed) Valve even referenced the Portal 1 GLaDOS Chassis at the very beginning of the game, which i thought was very beautiful. The fan made maps are good, the models are good, its just really good to me.

คุณรับบทเป็นอาสาสมัครทดสอบงานวิจัย(แบบไม่เต็มใจ)ของศูนย์วิจัย Aperture ซึ่งการควบของทั้งศูนย์คุมตกไปมือของ ระบบคอมพิวเตอร์ปัญญาประดิษฐ์ GlaDOS คุณได้ยำเธอเละไปในภาคก่อน แน่นอนเธอไม่ดีใจแน่ที่เจอคุณอีกรอบ

ในมือคุณมี Portal Gun ปืนสร้างประตูมิติที่สามารถทะลุถึงกันได้ ฟังดูแล้วไม่ค่อยมีคุณสมบัติอะไรแต่เมื่อใช้ร่วมกับ
สภาพแวดล้อมต่างๆในเกมส์แล้ว(หักเหลำแสงเลเซอร์ เปิดช่องให้ของเหลว ๆลๆ) Portal Gun เป็นเครื่องมีอที่สร้างสรรเอามากๆ อนุภาพจำกัดอยู่แค่การแก้ไขปัญหาของคุณ

This game gave me gas and diarrhea. No really. Unlike the first Portal, the movement and environments in this game gave me motion sickness, which is more common than you think within the world of FPS style games, not that this is an FPS, but you catch my drift. Actually, I never understood that idiom. "Catch my drift"? What the hell does that come from? Well, I'll tell you. It was slang from decades ago about farting. Did you know that? Now you do. So basically, "did you catch my drift" was actually asking "did you smell my dreadful bowel odors". And how apropos is that within the subject matter in this review?

But I digress.

So ya, I got ill. Basically, the environment and movement gave me intense vertigo, which in turn made my stomach upset, as is the case with anyone having a motion-related reaction.  As a result, my body started producing vast amount of gas, which is also common with motion-sickness. I got the vapours something dreadful. And the smell? Wretched! And for the icing on this foul cake? DIARRHEA!

I should consider legal action to replace several pairs of designer pants which were soiled as a result of this horrid game. SHAME ON YOU, VALVE! I can still smell the mud, which was easy enough to remove from the floor, but what about my clothes, area rug, and expensive ergonomic office chair? How about that, Valve??!! Answer THAT and stay fashionable!

Not to mention the overwhelming shame I felt when my girlfriends showed up right when the stool hit the fan….almost literally. Oh the mess! Oh the smell! Oh the shame! They acted sympathetic at the time, but only days later I started seeing and hearing mockery related to the incident.  Twice now, I’ve been around the dorms when “Stephy Stephy…poo poo pants” was subtly being chanted on another floor, loud enough for me to hear it. I even started getting spam from companies selling products for incontinence. Thanks Valve!!!!!

Sure, not everyone will get explosive/projectile diarrhea from playing this highly over-rated game, but some will! And because of this, THERE NEEDS TO BE A WARNING! Cmon, entire product lines have been dropped or recalled because of a single injury. We, the people with weak bowels, aren’t asking for a damn recall, just a simple warning! Something like:  “Caution, playing this game may cause anal leakage”. See? Simple and to the point.

Additionally, I can’t say I enjoyed the game much. Even between waves of the chocolate-tsunami, I do remember I was not entirely impressed with the levels, the VO work, or the writing. It wasn’t horrible, but it certainly lacked a lot of the charm which the first installment had in spades. Why do we refer to something which has a lot of something else, as having it in “spades”? I find that offensive.

So in closing, a pair of Depend adult undergarments might be the only way to play this game with any confidence if you have Irritable Bowel Syndrome, a spastic colon, or a predisposition towards visually-induced motion sickness. You have been warned!

***REVIEW FOR MAC***

Model

Mac Air, Mid-2012, 13" (Model No. 5.2)
Intel i5 - 1,8 Ghz
Intel HD 4000
RAM: 4GB
SSD: 128 GB

I've played the game to death on Windows, but I was wondering if it worked OK on a Mac. The game is awesome, don't worry about that, see other reviews for its awesomeness =)

On a Mac you can easily be playing on Native (1440 x 900) with all details max without problems. As you can see the Mac Air I tested Portal 2 on is not exactly a power house, but it just works phenomenally well.

The fan will become a bit warmer and I recommend using a portable (preferable bluetooth) keyboard and a mouse.

In Conclusion

Yes Mac lovers, there are some great games out there even for us =)

Okay puzzle games are fun... Maybe not but some can be right? Well Portal 2 is a different game. You get laughed at by a master computer with a wise arse voice for being human. Ah the comedy element, which can actually piss you off. Personally I'm gonna pull the plug on dis bit- I mean this evil IBM. I never even played Portal but Portal 2 on a chance is fun. Watch out for little enemy robots with lasers and machine guns with little Butters voices. The game is moderesk with graphics that are simple but space age. The game is puzzle solving like no other. Pop a portal here, enter one here on the ceiling, on the floor into your Sister's bedroom ummm... Well anyway the game is just fantastic fun and solving the puzzles can put your brain into a frenzy of wanting put a portal in your big screen, but don't do that. Figure the game out, it's fun, modern, unique and I promise you can't stop. 9-10.

我在steam上第一款游戏就是portal，一代带给了我很多乐趣，我曾经玩了三遍portal，这的确是一款很优秀的游戏。因此我对二代期望很大。portal2没有辜负我的期望，他比一代更优秀，加入了更多元素，并且可以和基友联机，确实是给了我很多惊喜。同时剧情也将主人公和Glados的关系阐明，虽然没有明说，但是通过某些细节玩家可以看出很多东西。portal2绝对不会辜负你的期望。

Amazing game.

The start is interesting to learn the basics of, but later on it turns into challenging rooms that will make your brain hurt. It gives an urge to just google how to do a chamber, yet you also want to find out for yourself.

It's not a game you can just sit in front of for a few hours. One multiplayer course can take an hour or two, and the frustration from some chambers can lead to ragequitting quickly, but if you pace yourself, you will love this game.
This game will make you think, it's really fun and funny with great voice acting. Cracks me up, great game to play when you're feeling blue.

confusing as heck, enjoyed staring at my own butt through portals

Portal 2 is a great game! Compared to Portal, it has soo many new things that make my excitement meter go crazy. First of all, there are more puzzles. I can beat Portal in half an hour, this would take a considerable amount of time, and even when I play it the second, third, etc. time, it's still quite fun. Another great thing is the soundtrack. Before buying this game, you can go the Portal 2 website and take a listen. I got is during the midweek madness in the summer of 2014, and I hope that you catch it then, 'cause it's only CAD $5 then. Try it out; it's worth your money and time. NOTE!!! I highly recommend playing the first game (for the story; it's important).

A wonderful puzzler. It carries on the charm and wit of the original's mechanics and story and improves upon them. Often on sale, the game even at full price is still worth every penny.

The Co-op is also amazingly fun.

The voice acting and minimal amount of characters make the game even more rich. It's really one of videogaming's greatest masterpieces.

Great game, different from your average MOBA or FPS. The script just might be the wittiest I have heard ever in a video game. The puzzles are not impossible, but they do tug at your brain unless your like Mr. Speedrunner. I really enjoyed this game as a breathe of fresh air, and i bet you will too.
It's the first time in my life that I stumble upon a game so captivating, innovating and mind-challenging!
I would recomend this game to people who like interactive puzzles! :D
